Note that "subacute" and "correlation" are not diseases, but rather terms that describe the duration of the effect and the relationship between two variables, respectively. "Isoproterenol" is a drug that is used to induce hypertrophy in animal models, but it is not a disease. "Propranolol" is a drug that is used to treat various conditions, including hypertension, but it is not a disease itself.
